A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Unbelievably disappointed.  JJ left two years of cliff-hanger debates about the origins of Rey.  Rian Johnson not only squandered JJ's work\, but he destroyed Luke Skywalker.  That's an unforgivable blow of a lifetime.  How could they possibly have given the control of such an epic to this man?  He singlehandedly crushed star wars.  Unbelievable.  Hayden C. must be laughing his ass off - the first three-quils have just been fully redeemed by comparison.  No amount of pretty CGI can wash away the abomination that was this plot.  I feel bad for Mark H.  I feel bad for the other actors who did a really great job.  Adam Driver was really outstanding and played the role as he should have been.  This was squarely a flopper because of the director.   Forget Star Wars 9.  There is no cliff hanger going into the next episode.  Just a train wreck.  Not even the almighty JJ can resurrect after that.
